gfvoChecker.title: Assess permit exemption under the 2nd GFVO
gfvoChecker.intro: Answer three questions to receive a legally grounded assessment of whether your facility is permit-free.
gfvoChecker.disclaimer:
Note: This tool provides orientation.
It checks whether your business generally falls under an exemption of Vienna‚Äôs 2nd Permit Exemption Ordinance.
The result is not an administrative decision or legal advice under the Legal Services Act.
The binding decision is made by MA 36 (Vienna business facilities authority).

category.title: Which category applies to the facility?
category.description: Select the category from ¬ß 1 (1) nos. 1‚Äì13 of the 2nd GFVO that best matches your planned operation.
category.hint: Tip: If none apply, choose ‚ÄúNone of the categories‚Äù to receive an immediate permit-required result.

operatingTimes.title: Do you comply with the operating time limits?
operatingTimes.description: Permit-free facilities must run Monday‚ÄìFriday 06:00‚Äì22:00 and Saturday 06:00‚Äì19:00 (deliveries until 19:00/18:00).

compliant.title: Yes, we stay within these windows
compliant.description: Operation is limited to the hours specified in ¬ß 1 (2) of the 2nd GFVO.

notCompliant.title: No, longer opening/delivery times planned
notCompliant.description: Night-time, Sunday business or deliveries outside the permitted windows are foreseen.

operatingTimes.reminder: Exceptions apply only to accommodation, ice-cream parlours, textile pick-up stations, data centres as well as facilities in stations, airports, ports or approved complexes (¬ß 1 (2) 2nd GFVO).

exclusions.title: Do any ¬ß 2 2nd GFVO exclusions apply?
exclusions.description: Check every statement that fits. A single exclusion triggers the permit requirement.
exclusions.reminder: Only if none of the ¬ß 2 2nd GFVO exclusions are triggered will the facility remain permit-free.

retail.description: e.g. shop, boutique or store with max. 600 m¬≤ sales area.

regulatedStorage.description: E.g. larger amounts of flammable liquids, gas cylinders or LPG requiring specific storage (¬ß 2 (2) 2nd GFVO).

unregulatedHazards.description: Even without specific regulations, storing labelled hazardous chemicals triggers ¬ß 2 (3) 2nd GFVO.

labour.daylight: Natural daylight openings ‚â• 10% of floor area; justify exceptions for basements, etc.

labour.escapeWidths: Escape widths by occupancy: 1‚Äì20 people 1.0 m | 21‚Äì120 people 1.2 m | add 0.1 m per extra 10 people.
labour.emergencyDoors: Emergency exit widths: up to 40 people 0.8 m, up to 80 people 0.9 m, up to 120 people 1.0 m; doors >15 people must open in escape direction.

operationalDuties.startAfterPermit: Operation may only begin after the permit has become final (¬ß 74 Trade Act).
operationalDuties.periodicInspection: ¬ß 82b Trade Act: periodic inspection every 5 years (6 years for simplified procedure), except UMG register facilities.
operationalDuties.inspectionScope: Inspection covers compliance with permit, plans, and co-applicable regulations (¬ß 356b).
operationalDuties.inspectionCertificate: Inspection report must list facility, site, inspector competence, permits, checked regulations, and findings.
operationalDuties.deficiencyDuties: Remedy deficiencies promptly; non-compliance can trigger administrative fines (¬ß 366).

changeDuties.notifyChanges: Significant changes must be reported before implementation (¬ß 81 (3) Trade Act).
changeDuties.operationAfterNotice: Operate modified installations only after the authority's acknowledgement (within 2 months).
